snippet: The striking achievement of Union City, N.J. — bringing poor, mostly immigrant kids into the educational mainstream — argues for reinventing the public schools we have.
abstract: Op-Ed article by public policy Prof David L Kirp highlights way in which Union City, NJ, has brought poor, mostly immigrant children into educational mainstream, striking achievement that is good argument for reinventing public schools; contends main lesson from Union City's success is that school districts should devise long-term strategies reaching from preschool to high school that they then stick to and improve over time.
lead_paragraph: The striking achievement of Union City, N.J. — bringing poor, mostly immigrant kids into the educational mainstream — argues for reinventing the public schools we have.
